main event: A radar operator observed a single round, silver-colored object on the radar screen for approximately 2-3 minutes.
interesting points: The sighting occurred on July 3, 1962, at 2100 hours in Moraine, Ohio., The observed object was moving at a high rate of speed and maintained the same altitude throughout the observation., This sighting was categorized as a ground-radar type of observation., There were multiple sightings recorded in the area around the same time frame., Witnesses included radar operators who reported the event.
